content:
Well, the beta isn't as reliable as the release version, but you've used it for a long time. I feel you would be safer to stick with the release version, but as long as you do frequent (i.e., weekly) backups, it doesn't matter. I back up weekly and any problems are quickly behind me. You can revert to the release by going to thunderbird.net and downloading and installing over the top of the beta. Then, there may be a compatibilities.ini file in the profile to delete to avoid the message that the release is not compatible. BUT, my big suggestion is to do backups. To do that, I suggest these steps: - exit thunderbird - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to external media

And I was walking before you were born...  :)
creator: davidsk

content:
Hiervoor is het nodig een voorkeur weer in te schakelen.

Ga hiervoor naar het menu > Instellingen. Zoek naar config en klik op de knop Configuratie-editor. Bevestig dat u voorzichtig zult zijn. Typ vervolgens in het veld Voorkeursnaam zoeken de volgende voorkeur: mail.warn_on_delete_from_trash. Klik naast deze voorkeur op de knop Wisselen om de voorkeur om te schakelen. Sla de wijziging op en sluit de Configuratie-editor. Hierna zou er weer gevraagd moeten worden of het bericht moet worden verwijderd.
creator: markh2

What I am after is similar to what you get when you highlight something to cut or copy but instead of carrying out that action I used to have a system where I could highlight something in an email the same as if done by a highlighter pen on paperwork and the section of email, when sent, would be highlighted and the recipient would se it as highlighted.

content: Aha! get the addon, textmarker. it does that for HTML messages, working just like a highlighter and you can set the color. Works very well.
creator: davidsk

content: Many thanks, David, but how do I get the addon textmarker.
creator: delta.151

content: Have now got the addon. Just trying to download it.
creator: delta.151

content: - click hamburger (three stacked lines) icon in upper right - click addons&themes - click textmarker in search window - install - after install, click the icon of a wrench in the description field and set to your preferences. l - then, whenever you click the 'new message' button, you will see the textmarker icon on upper toolbar for use. It appears whether you're composing in HTML or plain text, but only works with HTML message.
creator: davidsk

content: Many thanks. That appears to solve the problem.

content: The 'again' appears beside the last 'move' that you did. that is, if you move message X to trash and later click another message to move somewhere, thunderbird remembers the last move that you did and includes that in context menu. the intent is to minimize user mouse clicks.

content:
It will help if you tell us whether your email account is POP (messages kept on PC), or IMAP (messages kept on server). My guess is IMAP, since you indicated that you have access to messages on both phone and PC Also, from menu bar, click help>about and share the version of Thunderbird that you are using.

I know nothing of Plusnet, but I have had good success with an email account at Gmail (free), one at Outlook (free), and one with gmx (also free), and one at Fastmail (fee), and there are others. All of those work with Thunderbird the same way, but that is something for you to make the decision on. If you switch, my suggestion is set up the new account at least a month or more before leaving Plusnet to ensure that you retain email access throughout, as you may have many people to notify of the switch.

We can advise on possibly upgrading your Thunderbird after you share the version in use. You mentioned the limited storage of Thunderbird. Actually, Thunderbird has no limits itself, but uses whatever resources the user provides.

So, next steps: you need to decide on a new email address if that is your desire. You will need to set on the PC and your phone. If you have difficulties, you can post here for help in that. I encourage that to be a new post, not a follow on from this one. When you want to exit Plusnet and save the messages, please make that another separate post to ensure you get assistance on that one topic. Finally, after you tell us which version you use, we can advise on the upgrade from this post.

So, at this time, the ball is in your court. Let us know.
creator: davidsk
